intro: Flickingeria flabelliformis, commonly known as the fan-leaf fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves that resemble a fan, giving it its common name. The plant belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is typically found in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture. Flickingeria flabelliformis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage.
